contentrichtext.text: '''Zou Sixin''' (born 5 August 1967) is a retired [[PR China|Chinese]] [[triple jump]]er, best known for finishing eighth at the 1992 Summer Olympics. His personal best was 17.31 metres, achieved in October 1990 in Beijing. This result places him second on the all-time Chinese performers list, only behind [[Zou Zhenxian]]. [http://www.iaaf.org/statistics/toplists/inout=O/ageGroup=N/season=0/gender=M/discipline=TJ/legal=A/index.html] ==Achievements== {| {{AchievementTable|Event=yes}} |- !colspan="6"|Representing {{CHN}} |- |1990 |[[1990 Asian Games|Asian Games]] |[[Beijing]], [[PR China|China]] |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |Triple jump | |- |rowspan=2|1991 |[[1991 IAAF World Indoor Championships|World Indoor Championships]] |[[Seville]], [[Spain]] |4th |Triple jump |- |Asian Championships |[[Kuala Lumpur]], [[Malaysia]] |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |Triple jump | |- |1992 |[[Athletics at the 1992 Summer Olympics|Olympic Games]] |[[Barcelona]], [[Spain]] |align="center" | 8th |Triple jump | |- |1993 |[[1993 East Asian Games|East Asian Games]] |[[Shanghai]], [[PR China|China]] |bgcolor="gold"| 1st |Triple jump | |- |1996 |[[1996 Summer Olympics|Olympic Games]] |[[Atlanta, Georgia|Atlanta, United States]] |21st |Triple jump |[[Athletics at the 1996 Summer Olympics â€“ Men's triple jump|16.53 m]] |} ==External links== *{{iaaf name|id=3678|name=Zou Sixin}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Zou, Sixin | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Chinese Triple jumper | DATE OF BIRTH = 5 August 1967 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zou, Sixin}} [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Chinese triple jumpers]] [[Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1992 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1996 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Olympic athletes of China]] [[Category:Asian Games medalists in athletics (track and field)]] {{PRChina-athletics-bio-stub}}
